block.p: Carolyn Grace Harper and Stephen Paul Hefner were married last evening at the Roman Catholic Church of Christ the King in New Vernon, N.J. The Rev. Timothy R. Lannon performed the ceremony.

Mrs. Hefner, 33, was a development officer at the Weill Cornell Center of New York Presbyterian Hospital until last month. She is to become the associate director of major gifts at Amherst College in Amherst, Mass., this month. She graduated from Colby College and received a master's degree in arts administration from New York University.
Carolyn Grace Harper and Stephen Paul Hefner were married last evening at the Roman Catholic Church of Christ the King in New Vernon, N.J. The Rev. Timothy R. Lannon performed the ceremony.

Mrs. Hefner, 33, was a development officer at the Weill Cornell Center of New York Presbyterian Hospital until last month. She is to become the associate director of major gifts at Amherst College in Amherst, Mass., this month. She graduated from Colby College and received a master's degree in arts administration from New York University.

She is the daughter of Carole M. Harper of Morris Plains, N.J., and Judge John J. Harper of Morristown, N.J. Her father is a State Superior Court judge in Morristown. Her mother is the senior vice president and director of clinical services at Planned Parenthood of Greater Northern New Jersey in Morristown.

Mr. Hefner, 40, is a senior vice president for sales, marketing and strategic planning at Kanzaki Specialty Papers, a paper-coating company in Springfield, Mass. He graduated from Iona College. He is a son of Jean Hefner of Rockville Centre, N.Y., and the late Wallace Hefner Jr. His mother retired as a sales associate at Harms Real Estate in Rockville Centre. His father was the director of engineering at St. Francis Hospital in Roslyn, N.Y.
